org.fluidity.composition.container

Interface ContextDefinition


  • public interface ContextDefinition
    Maintains context state during dependency resolution. This is an internal interface to be used by dependency injection container implementations.

    For any context dependent component, the context state consists of two sets of annotations: defined set and active set.

    The defined set contains all the annotations that have been defined along an instantiation path and is computed as we move downstream in the path by adding new qualifier annotations to it.

    The active set is computed as we go backward on the instantiation path by adding qualifier annotations from the defined set that are accepted by components on the path and removing them as we pass their definition.

    The active set is the component context that is passed to context dependent components and used also as a cache key for stateless (i.e., cacheable) components regardless of whether they themselves are context dependent or not.

    The above is implemented by

    1. creating an empty context definition object at the tail of some dependency path
    2. advancing to the next node along that path as we move downstream to each dependency of the current component and expanding the context with the qualifier annotations present at the new node
    3. narrowing a copy of the definition down to the contexts accepted by the current context that can then be used to
      • create the actual context to be injected to the current component upon instantiation
      • as a cache key to map the instantiated stateless component to
    4. collecting the copies of the definition carrying the active set for the resolved dependencies of the current component
    5. passing the resulting definition upstream.

    This context tracking algorithm ensures that between the component that defines some context and the ones that consume it, all intermediate components will also have a dedicated instance for the active context. This may appear counter-intuitive at first but this rule guarantees that context dependent components will indeed have a unique and isolated instance for each actual context in the application.

    Usage

     final ContainerServices services = …;
 final ContextDefinition definition = services.emptyContext();
 …
 final ComponentContext context = definition.create();

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ContextDefinition accept(Class<?> consumer)
      Narrows down the active context set to the annotation classes accepted by the given component.
      Map<Class<? extends Annotation>,Annotation[]> active()
      Returns the active context set.
      ContextDefinition advance(Type reference, boolean refine)
      Makes a copy and removes from it all Qualifier.Composition#IMMEDIATE qualifier annotations.
      ContextDefinition collect(Collection<ContextDefinition> contexts)
      Expands the active context set with annotations consumed by dependencies of the component at the current node in the instantiation path.
      ContextDefinition copy()
      Returns a new copy of the receiver.
      ComponentContext create()
      Returns a component context containing the active context set.
      ComponentContext create(Map<Class<? extends Annotation>,Annotation[]> map)
      Returns a component context containing the given context set.
      Map<Class<? extends Annotation>,Annotation[]> defined()
      Returns the defined context set in definition order.
      ContextDefinition expand(Annotation[] definition)
      Expands the defined context with the supplied annotations.
      boolean isEmpty()
      Tells if the context definition is empty.
      Component.Reference reference()
      Returns the current component reference.

    • Method Detail

      • expand

        ContextDefinition expand(Annotation[] definition)
        Expands the defined context with the supplied annotations.
        Parameters:
        definition - the annotations potentially defining new context.
        Returns:
        the receiver.

      • accept

        ContextDefinition accept(Class<?> consumer)
        Narrows down the active context set to the annotation classes accepted by the given component. If the consumer argument is null, the active set is simply cleared.
        Parameters:
        consumer - the class that may accept some qualifier annotations; may be null.
        Returns:
        the receiver.

      • collect

        ContextDefinition collect(Collection<ContextDefinition> contexts)
        Expands the active context set with annotations consumed by dependencies of the component at the current node in the instantiation path.
        Parameters:
        contexts - the context definitions carrying the active component set from the dependencies of the current component.
        Returns:
        the receiver.

      • defined

        Map<Class<? extends Annotation>,Annotation[]> defined()
        Returns the defined context set in definition order.
        Returns:
        the defined context set.

      • active

        Map<Class<? extends Annotation>,Annotation[]> active()
        Returns the active context set.
        Returns:
        the active context set.

      • copy

        ContextDefinition copy()
        Returns a new copy of the receiver.
        Returns:
        a new copy of the receiver.

      • advance

        ContextDefinition advance(Type reference,
                          boolean refine)
        Makes a copy and removes from it all Qualifier.Composition#IMMEDIATE qualifier annotations.
        Parameters:
        reference - the parameterized type of the reference to the component being advanced to.
        refine - tells whether the reference is just a more refined version of the last one (true) or an actual advance on the dependency path (false)
        Returns:
        the new copy of the receiver.

      • create

        ComponentContext create()
        Returns a component context containing the active context set.
        Returns:
        a component context containing the active context set.

      • create

        ComponentContext create(Map<Class<? extends Annotation>,Annotation[]> map)
        Returns a component context containing the given context set.
        Parameters:
        map - a context set.
        Returns:
        a component context containing the given context set.

      • reference

        Component.Reference reference()
        Returns the current component reference.
        Returns:
        the current component reference.

      • isEmpty

        boolean isEmpty()
        Tells if the context definition is empty.
        Returns:
        true if there is no qualifier annotation in the receiver; false otherwise.
